result.execSummary:
The defendant Clinton J Kramer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight Time. Sentence credit of 8 days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.
Mental Health/psychologicial evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. Attend Anger Management. Attend Parenting Class.

Contact allowed with D.M.T. and family as deemed appropriate by agent. Write a letter of apology to victim. Maintain full time employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained, Surcharge is imposed. Comply with any other conditions deemed appropriate by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
